4.summary: Implantation occurs. The blastocyst burrows into the uterine wall.

days.0: The blastocyst reaches the uterus and prepares for implantation.
days.1: Implantation begins; the outer cells start to form the placenta.
days.2: The amniotic sac begins to form.
days.3: The yolk sac produces blood cells while the placenta develops.
days.4: The embryo separates into three layers: ectoderm, mesoderm, endoderm.
days.5: The neural tube (brain/spinal cord precursor) begins to form.
days.6: hCG levels rise significantly, often detectable by home tests.

5.summary: The embryonic period begins. Key systems like the circulatory and nervous systems differentiate.

days.0: The heart tube forms and begins to beat irregularly.
days.1: The neural tube closes; folic acid is critical now.
days.2: Early structures for eyes and ears appear.
days.3: Limb buds for arms and legs emerge.
days.4: The umbilical cord replaces the yolk sac for nutrient transport.
days.5: Blood vessels form and connect to the heart.
days.6: The embryo looks tadpole-like with a small tail.

6.summary: Heartbeat becomes regular and detectable via ultrasound.

days.1: Nose, mouth, and ears take distinct shape.
days.5: The brain divides into distinct regions.
days.6: Small, jerky movements begin (imperceptible to mother).

7.summary: Rapid brain growth; head is large relative to body.

days.1: Eyelids start to form but remain fused.
days.3: The liver starts producing red blood cells.
days.5: Tooth buds develop in the gums.
days.6: The embryo produces waste (urine) into the amniotic fluid.

8.summary: Fingers and toes differentiate; tail disappears.

days.0: Webbed fingers and toes are visible.
days.1: The upper lip and nose tip form.
days.3: The embryonic tail is nearly gone.

9.summary: Transition from embryo to fetus. All essential organs are present.

days.1: External genitalia begin to form (though not visible yet).
days.4: Arms can bend at the elbow.
days.5: Intestines herniate into the umbilical cord temporarily.

10.summary: Vital organs are functioning. The fetus is less susceptible to congenital anomalies.

days.0: Fingernails and toenails are clearly defined.
days.1: Fine hair (lanugo) appears.
days.2: The spine is visible through the skin.
days.3: The forehead bulges due to brain growth.
days.4: The fetus can swallow amniotic fluid.
days.5: Joints allow limbs to bend freely.

11.summary: Facial features mature; external genitalia become distinct.

days.0: Hair follicles form on the scalp/body.
days.1: Ovaries or testes develop internally.

12.summary: Reflexes are stronger. The fetus can curl toes and make sucking motions.

days.1: Bone marrow produces white blood cells.
days.6: The fetus can frown and squint.

13.summary: End of First Trimester. Fingerprints form.

days.1: Veins are visible through the skin.
days.2: Females have approx. 2 million eggs in ovaries.
days.3: The placenta fully takes over nutrition.
days.6: Intestines are fully in the abdomen.

14.summary: Second Trimester begins! Baby can make facial expressions.

days.0: Baby can now grimace and squint.
days.1: The neck elongates; chin is off the chest.
days.2: Lanugo (fine hair) covers the body for warmth.
days.4: Kidneys produce urine released into amniotic fluid.
days.6: Spleen starts producing red blood cells.

15.summary: Baby can sense light even with eyes closed.

days.0: Baby can sense light through fused eyelids.
days.1: Taste buds are fully functional.
days.2: Legs are growing longer than arms.
days.3: Joints are all working; baby is wriggling.
days.4: Three small bones in the inner ear harden.
days.5: Skin is very thin; blood vessels visible.
days.6: Heart is pumping ~25 quarts of blood a day.

16.summary: Spine and back muscles are strengthening.

days.0: Baby can hold its head up straighter.
days.1: Facial muscles can move (frown/squint).
days.2: Scalp pattern for hair is established.
days.6: Baby may start sucking on thumb.

17.summary: Fat stores begin to develop under the skin.

days.1: Umbilical cord grows thicker/stronger.
days.3: Skeleton is transforming from cartilage to bone.
days.4: Sweat glands are starting to develop.
days.5: Placenta is growing to accommodate baby's needs.
days.6: Loud noises might startle the baby.

18.summary: Ears move to final position; hearing improves.

days.0: Ears are in their final position on the head.
days.1: Baby can hear your heartbeat and digestion.
days.2: Retinas are becoming sensitive to light.
days.5: Baby may be active enough for you to feel.
days.6: Hiccups may occur (felt as rhythmic jumps).

19.summary: Vernix caseosa (waxy coating) forms on skin.

days.0: Vernix caseosa protects skin from amniotic fluid.
days.1: Sensory areas for smell, taste, hearing, vision develop.
days.3: Arms and legs are in proportion.
days.5: Baby sleeps and wakes in cycles.

20.summary: Halfway there! Anatomy scan usually happens now.

days.0: You are halfway through your pregnancy!
days.1: Baby swallows more to practice digestion.
days.2: Eyebrows and eyelids are fully formed.
days.4: Baby moves freely in the amniotic sac.
days.5: Heartbeat is audible with a stethoscope.

days.0: Small intestine absorbs sugar from swallowed fluid.
days.1: Liver and spleen regulate blood cells.
days.3: Bone marrow takes over red blood cell production.
days.4: Eyelids are still shut but eyes move behind them.
days.6: Baby has a regular sleep/wake schedule.

days.0: Baby explores face and hands by touch.
days.1: Grip is strong enough to hold umbilical cord.
days.2: Eyes are fully formed but irises lack color.
days.5: Baby can hear muffled voices from outside.
days.6: Fine hair (lanugo) covers the entire body.

days.1: Skin is translucent and red/wrinkled.
days.2: Bones in the middle ear harden further (hearing sharpens).

24.summary: Viability milestone: Lungs sacs begin to form.

days.0: Baby is considered 'viable' (can survive with help).
days.1: Alveolar sacs form in lungs.

days.0: Capillaries fill with blood (skin looks pinker).
days.1: Air sacs in lungs develop further.
days.5: Baby responds to touch on belly.

26.summary: Eyes open for the first time.

days.1: Retinas develop further.
days.3: Brain wave activity increases for senses.

27.summary: Brain activity shows response to stimuli.

days.1: Baby can distinguish your voice from others.
days.3: Lungs are capable of breathing air (with help).
days.5: Baby can suck thumb for comfort.
days.6: Skin is less wrinkled as fat adds.

days.1: Body fat increases to regulated temp.
days.5: Bones are fully developed but soft.

29.summary: Bones are fully developed but soft.

days.0: Baby is very active; kicks are strong.
days.1: Skull bones remain separate (for birth).
days.4: Baby reacts to foods you eat.

days.0: Brain surface folds to fit in skull.
days.1: Red blood cells form in bone marrow.
Baby turns head side to side.

32.summary: Baby practices breathing; preparing for birth.

days.0: Baby practices breathing movements 10-40% of time.
days.1: Toenails are visible.
days.3: Digestive system is ready for milk.

33.summary: Immune system is developing; antibodies transfer.

days.0: Antibodies pass from mother to baby.
days.1: Amniotic fluid levels stay constant.
days.3: Baby drinks a pint of amniotic fluid daily.

34.summary: Central nervous system connects; lungs mature.

days.1: Vernix coating gets thicker.
Liver processes some waste.
days.3: Baby gains ~1/2 lb per week now.
days.6: Baby occupies most of the uterus.

days.1: Lungs are ready to breathe air.
days.3: Vernix and lanugo shed into amniotic fluid.

37.summary: Early Term! Baby is ready for birth.

days.1: Baby practices breathing continuously.
days.4: Head hair may be full and thick.

38.summary: Vocal cords are ready for the first cry.

days.1: Brain controls all organ systems.
days.4: Eye color is likely blue/gray/brown (changes later).

39.summary: Full Term. Baby waits for the signal.

days.1: New skin cells replace old ones.
days.2: Lungs secrete signals to start labor.

40.summary: Due Date! Baby is fully ready.

days.1: Only 5% of babies arrive on due date.
days.3: Skull bones are soft for delivery.
days.4: Baby reserves starch for birth energy.
days.6: Baby is ready to meet you!

days.1: Baby continues to gain weight.
days.4: Nails may need trimming at birth.

days.1: Monitoring is frequent.
